select1.label: Wash hands.
Bring equipments to bed side.
Close bed side curtain or room door.
Raise or lower bed to comfortable working height.
Assist client to supine or semi fowler's position with arms extended to form straight line from shoulder to wrist. Place small pillow or towel under upper arm.
Ask parent or staff member to restrain child so that venipuncture site is immobilized.
Apply disposable gloves.
Apply tourniquet 5-15 cm above venipuncture site selected. Encircle extremity and pull one end of tourniquet over other. Apply tourniquets so it can be removed pulling end with single motion.
Palpate distal pulse below tourniquet. If pulse not palpable, reapply tourniquet more loosely.
Keep tourniquet for no longer than 1-2 minutes.
Ask client to open and close fist several times, finally leaving fist clenched.
Quickly inspect extremity for venipuncture site, looking for straight, prominent vein without swelling or hematoma.
Palpate selected vein with index finger. Note if vein is firm and rebounds when palpated or if vein feels rigid and cord like when palpated.
Select venipuncture site (if tourniquet on arm is too long, remove and assess other extremity or wait 60 seconds before reapplying).

Obtain blood sample
Syringe method
-Have syringe with appropriate needle securely attached. -Cleanse venipuncture site with alcohol swab, moving in circular motion from site for approximately 5 cm. Allow to dry. -Remove needle cover and inform client 'stick' lasting for few seconds felt. -Place thumb or forefinger of non dominant hand 2.5 cm above or below site and pull skin taut. -Hold syringe and needle at 15-30 degree angle from client's arm with bevel up. -Slowly insert needle into vein. -Hold syringe gently and pull back genly on plunger. -Look for blood return. -Obtain desired amount of blood keeping needle stabilized. -After specimen is obtained, release tourniquet. -Apply 2x2 gauze pad or antiseptic swab over puncture site without applying pressure and quickly, carefully withdraw needle from vein. Vacutainer method -Attach double ended needle to vacutainer tube -Have proper blood specimen tube resting inside vacutainer but do not punctuate rubber stopper. -Cleanse vein puncture site with alcohol swab, moving in circular motion out from site for approximately 5 cm. -Remove needle cover and inform client 'stick' lasting for few seconds felt. -Place thumb or forefinger of non dominant hand 2.5 cm above or below site and pull skin taut. Stretch skin down until vein is stabilized. -Hold vacutainer at 15-30 degree angle from clients arm with bevel up. -Slowly insert needle into vein. -Specimen tube into needle of holder (don't advance needle into vein). -Note flow of blood into tub. -After specimen tube is filled, grasp vacutainer firmly and remove tube. Insert additional specimen tubes as needed. -After last tube is filled release tourniquet. -Apply 2x2 gauze pad or over puncture site without applying pressure and quickly, carefully withdraw needle from vein.
Immediately apply pressure over venipuncture site with gauze or antiseptic pad for 2-3 minutes or until bleeding stops. Apply pressure over site and tape gauze dressing securely.
For blood obtained by syringe transfer specimen to tubes. Insert needle through stopper of blood tubes and allow vacuum to fill tube. Don't force blood into tube.
Take blood tubes containing additives and gently rotate back and forth 8 to 10 times.
Inspect puncture site for bleeding and apply adhesive tape with gauze.
Check tubes for any sign of external contamination with blood. Decontaminate with 70% alcohol, if necessary.
Remove disposable gloves after specimen obtained and any spillage cleaned.
Assist client to comfortable position.
Securely attach properly completed identification label to each tube and affix proper requisition.
Dispose off needles, syringes, and soiled equipment in proper container. Don't cap needle.
Wash hands after procedure.
